alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 1:31PM MST until August 20 at 4:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE TELEGRAPH BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR GILA COUNTY... At 131 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain over the Telegraph Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar has resulted in elevated flows through the Bloody Tanks Wash. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Telegraph Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Telegraph Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Miami and Claypool. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
